author: gumb00
content:
Small fix in EOF megaspec https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/mega-eof-specification, added validation rule:
> - During `JUMPF`, the following must hold: `stack_height + types[code_section_index].max_stack_height <= 1024`

This is stack overflow check during stack validation, we had it for `CALLF`, but forgot to have the same for `JUMPF`

author: _shemnon
content:
For tomorrows call can we get some progress / clarity on:

* add EXTDATALOAD - to support on-chain data storage
* add JUMPFI/CALLFI - to support Vyper's compiler concerns

author: _shemnon
content: Also we may need to discuss opcode renumeringing if either of those are in.

author: _shemnon
content: (clarity meaning more clarity on if it is in/viable or out/not viable)

author: _shemnon
content: Also, the whole wrapping of wrapped EOF containers to create new contracts feels clunky.  Does my CREATEF proposal sound viable to address it?
